item.title: wrestling the web from corporate control requires making it boring again
item.author: Juno Takano
item.description: In an age where web is essential, we need a universal web browser for minority platforms. One that focuses on keeping HTML+JS working rather than chasing things like â€œWebVRâ€ and collaborating with the ads industry. Unfortunately, I think the system has been set up to ensure that small players are no longer possible. Letâ€™s hope Iâ€™m proven wrong.

item.description: In necroreticular flows which cut across algorithmically distributed gigs and connected places of work, the number of lives integrated together corresponds to the interoperable potential of the reticular societyâ€™s optimization and domination, subsuming life and in so doing circulating death.

item.title: carl: modern version of cal that can incorporate ICal (ics) data
item.author: Juno Takano
item.description:
This is superb in conjunction with vdirsyncer, which Iâ€™ve been using for a long time for exactly the purpose of having a local directory of .ics files for each of my Nextcloud DAV calendars.

If you like this, you may also like khal.

item.title: Release tmux 3.5 Â· tmux/tmux
item.author: Juno Takano
item.description:
Interesting changes include:

  • â€œDisplay hyperlinks in copy mode and add copy_cursor_hyperlink format to get the hyperlink under the cursor.â€
  • â€œAdd a prefix timeout option.â€
  • â€œAdd mirrored versions of the main-horizontal and main-vertical layouts where the main pane is bottom or right instead of top or left.â€
  • â€œAdd --enable-jemalloc to build with jemalloc memory allocator (since glibc malloc is so poor).â€
  • â€œAdd N to search backwards in tree modes.â€
  • â€œUse default-shell for command prompt, #() and popups.â€
  • â€œAdd a command-error hook when a command fails.â€
